topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1 Beta: Deploying the Denver Template

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1 Beta: Installation Overivew

body.p: This document describes the process for installing HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

section.title: About the installation
section.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Denver Deployment installs the lifecycle manager, creates a base HP Helion OpenStack cloud, configures network virtualization through Accelerated vSwitch (AVS), and deploys a carrier grade cloud.
After installation, you can interact with the HP Helion OpenStack cloud using the Horizon graphical interface or using the CLIs of the respective services.

p.b: KVM Topology using the denver template

section.p: If installing the denver template, you are installing the KVM Region and HP Helion OpenStack AVS networking.
You can also integrate HPE Storevirtual (VSA) or HPE StoreServ (3PAR) storage in the KVM region.

You must install 3PAR or VSA before starting the HP Helion OpenStack installation and are independent of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. During the installation, you will integrate the storage into HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. See the installation instructions for the 3PAR and/or VSA parameters you will need.

section.title: Unbonded or Bonded NIC configuration
section.p: During the installation, specific steps might be different, based on whether you are installing into a single NIC or bonded NIC environment.

section.p: Before starting the installation, review the following topics:

Technical Overview for information on the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade environment.

Technical Specifications for dimensions and limits of the current versrion of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.
Support Matrix to make sure your environment meets the minimum requirements.

section.title: Installation process
section.p: Use the following process to install HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

ol.li: Perform any required or optional installation prerequisites.
Install the HPE Helion OpenStack cloud. These components will be installed into what is called the Standard Region.
Install the carrier grade cloud. The carrier grade cloud is deployed into what is called the KVM region.

After the deployment is complete, do a full backup of the deployment. This will make it easier to recover should you encounter a problem. For more information, see Backup and Restore Configuration Files.
